title: Calian Bulletin 01
body:
Notifications 

Notifications would go out to users if a new bulletin is posted when they're actively online. 

Expiration

Bulletins would also have an expiration date (can be null) which would make the bulletin dissapear from view after a given date. This would be for displaying information that's only relevant over a given period of time.

Permissions 

Only users with a given permission level would be able to post notifications. This could either be tied to role (Administrator & Senior Leader) or an additional permission could be added for the user manager.

title: Calian Bulletin 02 That Has A Long Name That Is Very Long!!
body:
Bulletins

Bulletins can be written with the rich-text-editor already built into Maestro and stored as html in the database. They would display in order of newest to oldest.

Red Notification Icon

The time and date of posting/modification would be stored along with it, allowing the system to show a red notification icon for the number of bulletins since they last logged in. This would allow for a simple system that doesn't need extra linking tables in the database for tracking who has viewed what bulletins, however the trade-off is less accuracy.

The alternative is to create a linking table for each user, showing whether or not they've viewed each individual bulletin. This would require more modification, but also be more accurate for giving the user proper notifications
